analyzed: bdag @11a *// ni rnam par rig pa dang dbyer med pa rnam par rig pa med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I myself am standing in the knowledge of the nonexistence of consciousness, which is inseparable from consciousness,

original: gzhan dag kyang rnam par rig pa dang dbyer med pa rnam par rig pa med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang rnam par rig pa dang dbyer med pa rnam par rig pa med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will cause others to stand in the knowledge of the nonexistence of consciousness, which is inseparable from consciousness.’🔽In this context, the nonexistence of consciousness, which is inseparable from consciousness, is the nature of consciousness.

original: de la rnam par rig pa dang dbyer med pa rnam par rig pa med pa ni rnam par rig pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par rig pa dang dbyer med pa rnam par rig pa med pa ni rnam par rig pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rnam par rig pa med pa ni rnam par rig pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa med pa ni rnam par rig pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the nonexistence of consciousness is nothing other than the nature of consciousness.

original: rnam par rig pa'i rang bzhin las rnam par rig pa med pa gzhan med pas rnam par rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i rang bzhin las rnam par rig pa med pa gzhan med pas rnam par rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
translated: Since there is nothing other than the nature of cognition that is not cognition, the nature of cognition itself is not cognition.

original: rnam par rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rig pa med pa shes pa des chos thams cad rnam par rig pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rig pa med pa shes pa des chos thams cad rnam par rig pa med pa ste /
translated: By knowing the nature of cognition to be not cognition, all phenomena are not cognition.

original: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur pa'o //🔽'jam dpal gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur pa'o // 'jam dpal gzhan yang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, these five discoveries of inspiration purify the first ground of the bodhisattvas.

original: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, there are also five discoveries of inspiration that purify the first ground of the bodhisattvas.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are these five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag ni ming dang dbyer med pa ming med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni ming dang dbyer med pa ming med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: ‘I abide in the knowledge of the namelessness that is inseparable from the name.

original: gzhan dag kyang ming dang dbyer med pa ming med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ming dang dbyer med pa ming med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “ One can find inspiration by thinking, ‘I will live by understanding the absence of names, which is no different than names, and I will help others to understand the absence of names, which is no different than names.’

original: de la ming dang @11b dbyer med pa ming med pa ni ming gi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming dang @11b dbyer med pa ming med pa ni ming gi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: “ In this case, the absence of names, which is no different than names, refers to the nature of names.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ming med pa ni ming gi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ming med pa ni ming gi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the absence of names is nothing other than the nature of names.

original: ming gi rang bzhin las ming med pa gzhan med pas ming gi rang bzhin nyid ming med pa ste /
analyzed: ming gi rang bzhin las ming med pa gzhan med pas ming gi rang bzhin nyid ming med pa ste /
translated: Since the absence of names is nothing other than the nature of names, the nature of names is itself the absence of names.

original: ming gi rang bzhin gyi ming med pa shes pa des chos thams cad ming med pa'o //🔽bdag ni bdag dang dbyer med pa bdag med pa'i ye shes la gnas kyi /
analyzed: ming gi rang bzhin gyi ming med pa shes pa des chos thams cad ming med pa'o // bdag ni bdag dang dbyer med pa bdag med pa'i ye shes la gnas kyi /
translated: By understanding the absence of names, which is the nature of names, one understands that all phenomena are without names.

original: gzhan dag kyang bdag dang dbyer med pa bdag med pa'i ye shes la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bdag dang dbyer med pa bdag med pa'i ye shes la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “ One can find inspiration by thinking, ‘I will live by the wisdom of selflessness, which is no different than the self, and I will help others to live by the wisdom of selflessness, which is no different than the self.’

original: de la bdag dang dbyer med pa bdag med pa ni bdag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag dang dbyer med pa bdag med pa ni bdag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: The selflessness that is inseparable from that is the nature of the self.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag med pa ni bdag gi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag med pa ni bdag gi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Selflessness is not other than the nature of the self.

original: bdag gi rang bzhin las bdag med pa gzhan med pas bdag gi rang bzhin nyid bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin las bdag med pa gzhan med pas bdag gi rang bzhin nyid bdag med pa ste /
translated: Since selflessness is not other than the nature of the self, the nature of the self is itself selflessness.

original: bdag gi rang bzhin gyi bdag med pa shes pa des chos thams cad bdag med pa'o //🔽bdag ni rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa dang / dbyer med pa rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin gyi bdag med pa shes pa des chos thams cad bdag med pa'o // bdag ni rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa dang / dbyer med pa rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: By knowing the selflessness that is the nature of the self, all phenomena are selfless.🔽“I stand in the knowledge that the self is inseparable from the activity of the coming together of causes and conditions, and that the self is the absence of the activity of the coming together of causes and conditions.

original: gzhan dag kyang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa dang dbyer med pa'i rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa dang dbyer med pa'i rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will cause others to stand in the knowledge that the self is inseparable from the activity of the coming together of causes and conditions, and that the self is the absence of the activity of the coming together of causes and conditions.”

original: de la rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa dang dbyer med pa rgyu dang rkyen tshogs @12a *//
analyzed: de la rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa dang dbyer med pa rgyu dang rkyen tshogs @12a *//
translated: The activity of the assembly of causes and conditions is not separate from that which is without the activity of the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: pa'i byed pa med pa ni rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i byed pa med pa ni rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is the activity of the assembly of causes and conditions is itself that which is without the activity of the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa ni rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa ni rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: That which is without the activity of the assembly of causes and conditions is not other than the nature of the activity of the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa las rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa gzhan med pas rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa las rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa gzhan med pas rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa ste /
translated: Because that which is without the activity of the assembly of causes and conditions is not other than the activity of the assembly of causes and conditions, the nature of the activity of the assembly of causes and conditions is itself that which is without the activity of the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa'i rang bzhin shes pa des chos thams cad rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa'i rang bzhin shes pa des chos thams cad rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i byed pa med pa'o //
translated: Through knowing that nature of that which is without the activity of the assembly of causes and conditions, all phenomena are without the activity of the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: bdag ni dbye ba dbyer med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni dbye ba dbyer med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I shall stand in the knowledge of the inseparability of syllables,

original: gzhan dag kyang dbye ba dbyer med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang dbye ba dbyer med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I shall establish others in the knowledge of the inseparability of syllables.

original: de la dbye ba dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin ni dbye ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbye ba dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin ni dbye ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: ” There the nature of the inseparability of syllables is the nature of syllables.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽dbyer med pa ni dbye ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / dbyer med pa ni dbye ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why is that?🔽Inseparability is not other than the nature of syllables.

original: dbye ba'i rang bzhin las dbyer med pa gzhan med pas dbye ba'i rang bzhin nyid dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: dbye ba'i rang bzhin las dbyer med pa gzhan med pas dbye ba'i rang bzhin nyid dbyer med pa ste /
translated: Since there is no inseparability apart from the nature of syllables, the nature of syllables is itself inseparability.

original: dbye ba'i rang bzhin gyi dbyer med pa shes pa des chos thams cad dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba'i rang bzhin gyi dbyer med pa shes pa des chos thams cad dbyer med pa'o //
translated: By knowing the inseparability of the nature of syllables, all phenomena are known to be inseparable.

original: bdag ni yi ge dang dbyer med pa yi ge med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni yi ge dang dbyer med pa yi ge med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I shall stand in the knowledge of the absence of syllables, which is inseparable from syllables,

original: gzhan dag kyang yi ge dang dbyer med pa yi ge med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang yi ge dang dbyer med pa yi ge med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I shall establish others in the knowledge of the absence of syllables, which is inseparable from syllables.🔽”

original: de la yi ge dang @12b dbyer med pa yi ge med pa ni yi ge'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yi ge dang @12b dbyer med pa yi ge med pa ni yi ge'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: The absence of syllables is the nature of syllables.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yi ge med pa ni yi ge'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yi ge med pa ni yi ge'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The absence of syllables is not other than the nature of syllables.

original: yi ge'i rang bzhin las yi ge med pa gzhan med pas yi ge'i rang bzhin nyid yi ge med pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i rang bzhin las yi ge med pa gzhan med pas yi ge'i rang bzhin nyid yi ge med pa'o //
translated: The absence of syllables is not other than the nature of syllables. Therefore, the nature of syllables is the absence of syllables.

original: yi ge'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge med pa shes pa des chos thams cad yi ge med pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge med pa shes pa des chos thams cad yi ge med pa ste /
translated: Through the knowledge of the absence of syllables in the nature of syllables, all phenomena are without syllables.

original: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //🔽'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o // 'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, these five discoveries of inspiration purify the bodhisattvas’ first ground.

original: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, there are also five discoveries of inspiration that purify the bodhisattvas’ first ground.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang dbyer med pa lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang dbyer med pa lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I stand in the knowledge that is inseparable from the absence of pride,

original: gzhan dag kyang lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang dbyer med pa lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang dbyer med pa lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will establish others in the knowledge that is inseparable from the absence of pride.’

original: de la lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang dbyer med pa lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang dbyer med pa lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: In this context, the absence of pride that is inseparable from the nature of pride is the nature of pride.

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: If you ask why, it is because the absence of pride is nothing other than the nature of pride.

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin las lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa gzhan med pas lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin nyid lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa ste /🔽lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin gyi lhag @13a *//
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin las lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa gzhan med pas lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin nyid lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa ste /🔽lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rang bzhin gyi lhag @13a *//
translated: Therefore, the absence of pride is not something other than the nature of pride. The nature of pride itself is the absence of pride.🔽The nature of pride is not one thing and the absence of pride another.

original: pa'i nga rgyal med pa shes pa des chos thams cad lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i nga rgyal med pa shes pa des chos thams cad lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa'o //
translated: By that knowledge of the absence of the pride of self-praise, all dharmas are without the pride of self-praise.

original: bdag ni bdag bstod pa dang dbyer med pa bdag bstod pa med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni bdag bstod pa dang dbyer med pa bdag bstod pa med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I stand in the knowledge that is inseparable from the absence of self-praise, which is the absence of self-praise.

original: gzhan dag kyang bdag bstod pa dang dbyer med pa bdag bstod pa med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bdag bstod pa dang dbyer med pa bdag bstod pa med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will also establish others in the knowledge that is inseparable from the absence of self-praise, which is the absence of self-praise.’

original: de la bdag bstod pa dang dbyer med pa bdag bstod pa med pa ni bdag bstod pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽bdag bstod pa med pa ni bdag bstod pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la bdag bstod pa dang dbyer med pa bdag bstod pa med pa ni bdag bstod pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na / bdag bstod pa med pa ni bdag bstod pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: There the absence of self-praise, which is inseparable from the absence of self-praise, is the nature of self-praise.🔽If you ask why, it is because the absence of self-praise is not something other than the nature of self-praise.

original: bdag bstod pa'i rang bzhin las bdag bstod pa med pa gzhan med pas bdag bstod pa'i rang bzhin nyid bdag bstod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag bstod pa'i rang bzhin las bdag bstod pa med pa gzhan med pas bdag bstod pa'i rang bzhin nyid bdag bstod pa med pa ste /
translated: The absence of self-praise is not something other than the nature of self-praise. The nature of self-praise is the absence of self-praise.

original: bdag bstod pa'i rang bzhin bdag bstod pa med pa shes pa des chos thams cad bdag bstod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag bstod pa'i rang bzhin bdag bstod pa med pa shes pa des chos thams cad bdag bstod pa med pa'o //
translated: By the knowledge that the nature of self-praise is the absence of self-praise, one knows that all phenomena are the absence of self-praise.

original: bdag ni drang ba'i don dang dbyer med pa'i nges pa'i don shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni drang ba'i don dang dbyer med pa'i nges pa'i don shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “ One should stand in the knowledge that the definitive meaning is inseparable from the provisional meaning,🔽and one should establish others in the knowledge that the definitive meaning is inseparable from the provisional meaning.

original: gzhan dag kyang drang ba'i don dang dbyer med pa nges pa'i don shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang drang ba'i don dang dbyer med pa nges pa'i don shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: ” Thus, one will find relief.

original: de la drang ba'i don dang dbyer med pas nges pa'i don ni drang ba'i don gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la drang ba'i don dang dbyer med pas nges pa'i don ni drang ba'i don gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: The definitive meaning that is inseparable from the provisional meaning is what the nature of the provisional meaning is.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽nges pa'i don ni drang ba'i don gyi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / nges pa'i don ni drang ba'i don gyi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: If you ask why,🔽it is because the definitive meaning is nothing other than the nature of the provisional meaning.

original: drang ba'i don gyi rang bzhin las nges pa'i @13b don gzhan med pas drang ba'i don gyi rang bzhin nyid nges pa'i don te /
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi rang bzhin las nges pa'i @13b don gzhan med pas drang ba'i don gyi rang bzhin nyid nges pa'i don te /
translated: The definitive meaning is not something other than the nature of the provisional meaning. The nature of the provisional meaning is the definitive meaning.

original: drang ba'i don gyi rang bzhin nges pa'i don shes pa nges chos thams cad nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi rang bzhin nges pa'i don shes pa nges chos thams cad nges pa'i don to //
translated: The nature of the interpretable meaning is the knowledge of the definitive meaning. All phenomena are the definitive meaning.

original: bdag po ni gang zag dang dbyer med pa chos nyid shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag po ni gang zag dang dbyer med pa chos nyid shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: The self is the knowledge of the reality-limit, which is indivisible from the person.

original: gzhan dag kyang gang zag dang dbyer med pa chos nyid shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang gang zag dang dbyer med pa chos nyid shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: And he should establish others in the knowledge of the reality-limit, which is indivisible from the person.

original: de la gang zag dang dbyer med pa chos nyid ni gang zag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang zag dang dbyer med pa chos nyid ni gang zag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: The reality-limit, which is indivisible from the person, is the nature of the person.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: chos nyid ni gang zag gi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos nyid ni gang zag gi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the reality-limit is none other than the nature of the person.

original: gang zag gi rang bzhin las chos nyid gzhan med pas gang zag gi rang bzhin nyid chos nyid de /
analyzed: gang zag gi rang bzhin las chos nyid gzhan med pas gang zag gi rang bzhin nyid chos nyid de /
translated: Since the reality-limit is nothing other than the nature of the person, the nature of the person is the reality-limit.

original: gang zag gi rang bzhin gyi chos nyid shes pa des chos thams cad chos nyid do //
analyzed: gang zag gi rang bzhin gyi chos nyid shes pa des chos thams cad chos nyid do //
translated: By knowing the reality-limit, which is the nature of the person, one knows all phenomena to be the reality-limit.

original: bdag ni log par lta ba dang dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i lta ba la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni log par lta ba dang dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i lta ba la gnas kyi /
translated: I abide in the right view, which is indivisible from the wrong view.

original: gzhan dag kyang log par lta ba dang dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i lta ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang log par lta ba dang dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i lta ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: They will also establish others in the right view, which is inseparable from wrong views.

original: de la log par lta ba dang dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i lta ba ni log par lta ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la log par lta ba dang dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i lta ba ni log par lta ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: “ Wrong views are the nature of the right view.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni log par lta ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni log par lta ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The right view is not other than the nature of wrong views.

original: log par lta ba'i rang bzhin las yang dag pa'i lta ba gzhan med pas log par lta ba'i rang bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i lta @14a *//
analyzed: log par lta ba'i rang bzhin las yang dag pa'i lta ba gzhan med pas log par lta ba'i rang bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i lta @14a *//
translated: The right view is not other than the nature of wrong views. The nature of wrong views is the right view.

original: pa'o; ;log par lta ba'i rang bzhin yang dag pa'i lta ba shes pa des chos thams cad yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: pa'o; ;log par lta ba'i rang bzhin yang dag pa'i lta ba shes pa des chos thams cad yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: “ Through the knowledge of the right view, which is the nature of wrong views, all phenomena are the right view.

original: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, these five discoveries of relief purify the first bodhisattva bhūmi.

original: 'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, moreover,

original: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
translated: bodhisattvas find five kinds of relief that purify from the very beginning.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag ni mtha' dang dbyer med pa mnyam pa nyid shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni mtha' dang dbyer med pa mnyam pa nyid shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: ‘I myself remain in the knowledge of sameness, which is inseparable from the extremes,

original: gzhan dag kyang mtha' dang dbyer med pa mnyam pa nyid shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang mtha' dang dbyer med pa mnyam pa nyid shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will cause others to remain in the knowledge of sameness, which is inseparable from the extremes.’

original: de la mtha' dang dbyer med pa mnyam pa nyid ni mtha'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtha' dang dbyer med pa mnyam pa nyid ni mtha'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the sameness that is inseparable from the extremes is the nature of the extremes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: mnyam pa nyid ni mtha'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni mtha'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is because sameness is nothing other than the nature of the extremes.

original: mtha'i rang bzhin las mnyam pa nyid gzhan med pas mtha'i rang bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: mtha'i rang bzhin las mnyam pa nyid gzhan med pas mtha'i rang bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: Since sameness is nothing other than the nature of the extremes, the nature of the extremes is itself sameness.

original: mtha'i rang bzhin gyi mnyam pa nyid shes pa des chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtha'i rang bzhin gyi mnyam pa nyid shes pa des chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Through the knowledge of the sameness that is the nature of the extremes, all phenomena are sameness.

original: bdag ni shes bya dang dbyer med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni shes bya dang dbyer med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I shall live in the knowledge that is inseparable from the object of knowledge,

original: gzhan dag kyang shes bya dang dbyer med pa'i shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang shes bya dang dbyer med pa'i shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I shall establish others in the knowledge that is inseparable from the object of knowledge.”

original: de la shes bya dang dbyer med pa shes pa ni shes @14b bya'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la shes bya dang dbyer med pa shes pa ni shes @14b bya'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that is inseparable from the object of knowledge is the nature of the object of knowledge.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes pa ni shes bya'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa ni shes bya'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because knowledge is not other than the nature of the object of knowledge.

original: shes bya'i rang bzhin las shes pa gzhan med pas shes bya'i rang bzhin nyid shes pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i rang bzhin las shes pa gzhan med pas shes bya'i rang bzhin nyid shes pa ste /
translated: Since knowledge is not other than the nature of the object of knowledge, the nature of the object of knowledge is knowledge.

original: shes bya'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa des chos thams cad shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa des chos thams cad shes pa'o //
translated: With that knowledge, which is the nature of the object of knowledge, all phenomena are known.

original: bdag ni 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa 'dzin pa med pa'i shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa 'dzin pa med pa'i shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I shall live in the knowledge that is inseparable from grasping and is free from grasping,

original: gzhan dag kyang 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa 'dzin pa med pa'i shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa 'dzin pa med pa'i shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I shall establish others in the knowledge that is inseparable from grasping and is free from grasping.”

original: de la 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa 'dzin pa med pa ni 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa 'dzin pa med pa ni 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: The absence of grasping is the nature of grasping.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dzin pa med pa ni 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa ni 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The absence of grasping is not other than the nature of grasping.

original: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin las 'dzin pa med pa gzhan med pas 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nyid 'dzin pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin las 'dzin pa med pa gzhan med pas 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nyid 'dzin pa med pa ste /
translated: The absence of grasping is not something other than the nature of grasping. The nature of grasping is itself the absence of grasping.

original: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'dzin pa med pa'i shes pa des chos thams cad 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'dzin pa med pa'i shes pa des chos thams cad 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: By that cognition, which is the absence of grasping that is the nature of grasping, all phenomena are without grasping.

original: bdag ni mtshan ma dang dbyer med pa mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni mtshan ma dang dbyer med pa mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I am one who is grounded in the cognition of the absence of defining marks, which is the same as the absence of defining marks.

original: gzhan dag kyang mtshan ma dang dbyer med pa mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang mtshan ma dang dbyer med pa mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will also establish others in the cognition of the absence of defining marks, which is the same as the absence of defining marks.”

original: de la mtshan ma dang dbyer med pa mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma dang dbyer med pa mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: The absence of defining marks, which is the same as the absence of defining marks, is the nature of defining marks.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma'i @15a *//🔽rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma'i @15a *// rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Signlessness is not other than the nature of signs.🔽Signlessness is not other than the nature of signs.

original: mtshan ma'i rang bzhin las mtshan ma med pa gzhan med pas mtshan ma'i rang bzhin nyid mtshan ma med pa ste; mtshan ma'i rang bzhin mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa des chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rang bzhin las mtshan ma med pa gzhan med pas mtshan ma'i rang bzhin nyid mtshan ma med pa ste; mtshan ma'i rang bzhin mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa des chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of signs is signlessness.

original: bdag ni bsgom pa dang dbyer med pa bsgom pa med pa'i shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni bsgom pa dang dbyer med pa bsgom pa med pa'i shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I abide in the knowledge that meditation is inseparable from the absence of meditation,

original: gzhan dag kyang bsgom pa dang dbyer med pa bsgom pa med pa'i shes pa la 'god do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bsgom pa dang dbyer med pa bsgom pa med pa'i shes pa la 'god do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will establish others in the knowledge that meditation is inseparable from the absence of meditation.’

original: de la bsgom pa dang dbyer med pa bsgom pa med pa ni bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la bsgom pa dang dbyer med pa bsgom pa med pa ni bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: In this case, meditation is inseparable from the absence of meditation, which is the nature of meditation.

original: bsgom pa med pa ni bsgom pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsgom pa med pa ni bsgom pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: If you ask why, it is because the absence of meditation is not other than the nature of meditation.

original: bsgom pa'i rang bzhin las bsgom pa med pa gzhan med pas bsgom pa'i rang bzhin nyid bsgom pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rang bzhin las bsgom pa med pa gzhan med pas bsgom pa'i rang bzhin nyid bsgom pa med pa'o //
translated: Since there is nothing other than the nature of meditation, the nature of meditation is itself the absence of meditation.

original: bsgom pa'i rang bzhin bsgom pa med pa'i shes pa des chos thams cad bsgom pa med pa ste; 'jam dpal /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rang bzhin bsgom pa med pa'i shes pa des chos thams cad bsgom pa med pa ste; 'jam dpal /
translated: Through that knowledge of the absence of meditation, which is the nature of meditation, all phenomena are absent of meditation.

original: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //🔽'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o // 'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, these five discoveries of relief purify the bodhisattvas’ first bhūmi.

original: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, there are also five discoveries of relief that purify the bodhisattvas’ first bhūmi.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are these five?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽bdag ni mtha' dang dbyer med pa @15b dbu ma'i lam shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / bdag ni mtha' dang dbyer med pa @15b dbu ma'i lam shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: They are as follows:🔽‘I abide in the knowledge of the middle way, which is free from extremes.

original: gzhan dag kyang mtha' dang dbyer med pa dbu ma'i lam shes pa la 'god do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang mtha' dang dbyer med pa dbu ma'i lam shes pa la 'god do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will also establish others in the knowledge of the middle way, which is free from extremes.’

original: de la mtha' dang dbyer med pa dbu ma'i lam ni mtha'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtha' dang dbyer med pa dbu ma'i lam ni mtha'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: The middle way that is not separate from the extremes is the nature of the extremes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtha'i rang bzhin las dbu ma'i lam gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtha'i rang bzhin las dbu ma'i lam gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The middle way is not separate from the nature of the extremes.

original: mtha'i rang bzhin las dbu ma'i lam gzhan med pas mtha'i rang bzhin nyid dbu ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: mtha'i rang bzhin las dbu ma'i lam gzhan med pas mtha'i rang bzhin nyid dbu ma'i lam ste /
translated: The middle way is not separate from the nature of the extremes. Therefore, the nature of the extremes is the middle way.

original: mtha'i rang bzhin dbu ma'i lam shes pa des chos thams cad dbu ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: mtha'i rang bzhin dbu ma'i lam shes pa des chos thams cad dbu ma'i lam mo //
translated: Through knowing the middle way as the nature of the extremes, all phenomena are the middle way.

original: bdag ni nam mkha' ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i nam mkha' shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni nam mkha' ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i nam mkha' shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I stand in the knowledge that space is not separate from what is not space,

original: gzhan dag kyang nam mkha' ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i nam mkha' shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang nam mkha' ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i nam mkha' shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I stand with the breath that refreshes others, saying, ‘I will cause them to stand in the knowledge that space is not separate from what is not space.’

original: de la nam mkha' ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i nam mkha' ni nam mkha' ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la nam mkha' ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i nam mkha' ni nam mkha' ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: In this case, space that is not separate from what is not space is the nature of what is not space.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nam mkha' ni nam mkha' ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni nam mkha' ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because space is not other than the nature of non-space.

original: nam mkha' ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las nam mkha' gzhan med pas /
analyzed: nam mkha' ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las nam mkha' gzhan med pas /
translated: Space is not other than the nature of non-space.

original: nam mkha' ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid nam mkha' ste /
translated: The nature of non-space is space.

original: nam mkha' ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi nam mkha' shes pa des chos thams cad nam mkha'o //🔽bdag ni mo gsham gyi @16a *//
analyzed: nam mkha' ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi nam mkha' shes pa des chos thams cad nam mkha'o // bdag ni mo gsham gyi @16a *//
translated: By knowing space as the nature of non-space, all phenomena are space.

original: bu ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i mo gsham gyi bu shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bu ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i mo gsham gyi bu shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I stand in the knowledge that the son of a barren woman is not other than what is inseparable from the son of a barren woman.

original: gzhan dag kyang mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i mo gsham gyi bu shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i mo gsham gyi bu shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will cause others to stand in the knowledge that the son of a barren woman is not other than what is inseparable from the son of a barren woman.”

original: de la mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i mo gsham gyi bu ni mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i mo gsham gyi bu ni mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: In this case, the son of a barren woman that is not other than what is inseparable from the son of a barren woman is the nature of the son of a barren woman.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why, it is because

original: mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las mo gsham gyi bu gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las mo gsham gyi bu gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the nature of the son of a barren woman is not other than the son of a barren woman.

original: mo gsham gyi bu'i rang bzhin las mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa gzhan med pas mo gsham gyi bu'i rang bzhin nyid mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu'i rang bzhin las mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa gzhan med pas mo gsham gyi bu'i rang bzhin nyid mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa ste /
translated: Because the nature of the son of a barren woman is not other than the son of a barren woman, the nature of the son of a barren woman is not the son of a barren woman.

original: mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi mo gsham gyi bu shes pa des chos thams cad mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi mo gsham gyi bu shes pa des chos thams cad mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: By knowing the son of a barren woman as the nature of the son of a barren woman, all phenomena are known to be like the son of a barren woman.

original: bdag ni smig rgyu ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i smig rgyu shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni smig rgyu ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i smig rgyu shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I stand in the knowledge that a mirage is not separate from the absence of a mirage,

original: gzhan dag kyang smig rgyu ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i smig rgyu shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang smig rgyu ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i smig rgyu shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will establish others in the knowledge that a mirage is not separate from the absence of a mirage.”

original: de la smig rgyu ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i smig rgyu shes pa ni smig rgyu ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la smig rgyu ma yin pa dang dbyer med pa'i smig rgyu shes pa ni smig rgyu ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that a mirage is not separate from the absence of a mirage is the nature of the absence of a mirage.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why, it is because the nature of the absence of a mirage is not the absence of a mirage.

original: smig rgyu ma yin pa ni smig rgyu'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smig rgyu ma yin pa ni smig rgyu'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: What is not a mirage is not other than the nature of a mirage.

original: smig rgyu'i rang bzhin las smig @16b rgyu ma yin pa gzhan med pas smig rgyu'i rang bzhin nyid smig rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: smig rgyu'i rang bzhin las smig @16b rgyu ma yin pa gzhan med pas smig rgyu'i rang bzhin nyid smig rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Because what is not a mirage is not other than the nature of a mirage, the nature of a mirage is not a mirage.

original: smig rgyu ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi smig rgyu'i shes pa des chos thams cad smig rgyu lta bu'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi smig rgyu'i shes pa des chos thams cad smig rgyu lta bu'o //
translated: The consciousness of a mirage that has the nature of what is not a mirage is like a mirage.

original: bdag ni log par lta ba dang dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i lta ba shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni log par lta ba dang dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i lta ba shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I stand in the knowledge of right view, which is inseparable from wrong view,

original: gzhan yang log par lta ba dang dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i lta ba shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang log par lta ba dang dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i lta ba shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will cause others to take up the knowledge of right view, which is inseparable from wrong view.’

original: de la log par lta ba dang dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i lta ba ni log par lta ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la log par lta ba dang dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i lta ba ni log par lta ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: In this case, right view, which is inseparable from wrong view, is the nature of wrong view.🔽If you ask why, it is because wrong view is not one thing and the nature of wrong view another.

original: log par lta ba'i rang bzhin las yang dag pa'i lta ba gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /🔽log par lta ba'i rang bzhin las yang dag pa'i lta ba gzhan med pas log par lta ba'i rang bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i rang bzhin las yang dag pa'i lta ba gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te / log par lta ba'i rang bzhin las yang dag pa'i lta ba gzhan med pas log par lta ba'i rang bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: because the nature of wrong views is not other than right views.🔽Since the nature of wrong views is not other than right views, the nature of wrong views is right views.

original: log par lta ba'i rang bzhin yang dag pa'i lta ba shes pa des chos thams cad yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i rang bzhin yang dag pa'i lta ba shes pa des chos thams cad yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: Through the knowledge of the nature of wrong views as right views, all phenomena are right views.

original: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //🔽'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o // 'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, these five discoveries of inspiration purify the bodhisattvas’ first ground.

original: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, there are also five discoveries of inspiration that purify the bodhisattvas’ first ground.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are these five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag ni ma rig pa dang dbyer med pa'i rig pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni ma rig pa dang dbyer med pa'i rig pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: ‘I abide in the knowledge that ignorance is inseparable from insight.

original: gzhan dag kyang ma rig pa dang dbyer med pa'i rig pa @17a *//
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ma rig pa dang dbyer med pa'i rig pa @17a *//
translated: Also, others are the knowledge that is inseparable from ignorance.🔽

original: shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “I will free others from ignorance and establish them in the knowledge that is inseparable from ignorance.”

original: de la ma rig pa dang dbyer med pa'i rig pa ni ma rig pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang dbyer med pa'i rig pa ni ma rig pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o /
translated: In this case, the knowledge that is inseparable from ignorance is the nature of ignorance.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rig pa ni ma rig pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rig pa ni ma rig pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Knowledge is not other than the nature of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin las rig pa gzhan med pas ma rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid rig pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin las rig pa gzhan med pas ma rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid rig pa ste /
translated: Knowledge is not other than the nature of ignorance. The nature of ignorance is knowledge.

original: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi rig pa shes pa des chos thams cad rig pa'o //🔽bdag ni 'dod chags dang dbyer med pa 'dod chags med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi rig pa shes pa des chos thams cad rig pa'o // bdag ni 'dod chags dang dbyer med pa 'dod chags med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: With the knowledge of the nature of ignorance, all phenomena are known.

original: gzhan dag kyang 'dod chags dang dbyer med pa 'dod chags med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang 'dod chags dang dbyer med pa 'dod chags med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “I will stand in the knowledge of the absence of desire that is inseparable from desire and establish others in the knowledge of the absence of desire that is inseparable from desire.”

original: de la 'dod chags dang dbyer med pa 'dod chags med pa ni 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang dbyer med pa 'dod chags med pa ni 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: The absence of passion that is inseparable from passion is the nature of passion.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod chags med pa ni 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te; 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin las 'dod chags med pa gzhan med pas 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin nyid 'dod chags med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa ni 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te; 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin las 'dod chags med pa gzhan med pas 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin nyid 'dod chags med pa ste /
translated: The absence of passion is not other than the nature of passion. Since the absence of passion is not other than the nature of passion, the nature of passion itself is the absence of passion.

original: 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin 'dod chags med pa shes pa des chos thams cad 'dod chags med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin 'dod chags med pa shes pa des chos thams cad 'dod chags med pa'o //
translated: By knowing the absence of passion, which is the nature of passion, all phenomena are the absence of passion.

original: bdag ni zhe sdang dang dbyer med pa zhe sdang med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni zhe sdang dang dbyer med pa zhe sdang med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I abide in the knowledge of the absence of hatred, which is inseparable from hatred,

original: gzhan dag kyang zhe sdang dang @17b dbyer med pa zhe sdang med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang zhe sdang dang @17b dbyer med pa zhe sdang med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will cause others to take up the knowledge of the absence of hatred, which is inseparable from hatred.’

original: de la zhe sdang dang dbyer med pa zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang gi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhe sdang dang dbyer med pa zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang gi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: The absence of hatred that is inseparable from hatred is the nature of hatred.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang gi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang gi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: If you ask why, it is because the absence of hatred is nothing other than the nature of hatred.

original: zhe sdang gi rang bzhin las zhe sdang med pa gzhan med pas zhe sdang gi rang bzhin nyid zhe sdang med pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rang bzhin las zhe sdang med pa gzhan med pas zhe sdang gi rang bzhin nyid zhe sdang med pa ste /
translated: Since the absence of hatred is nothing other than the nature of hatred, the nature of hatred is the absence of hatred.

original: zhe sdang gi rang bzhin zhe sdang med pa shes pa des chos thams cad zhe sdang med pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rang bzhin zhe sdang med pa shes pa des chos thams cad zhe sdang med pa'o //
translated: Through that knowledge of the absence of hatred as the nature of hatred, all phenomena are the absence of hatred.

original: bdag ni gti mug dang dbyer med pa gti mug med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni gti mug dang dbyer med pa gti mug med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I stand in the knowledge of the absence of delusion, which is indivisible from delusion,

original: gzhan dag kyang gti mug dang dbyer med pa gti mug med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang gti mug dang dbyer med pa gti mug med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will cause others to stand in the knowledge of the absence of delusion, which is indivisible from delusion.’

original: de la gti mug dang dbyer med pa gti mug med pa ni gti mug gi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la gti mug dang dbyer med pa gti mug med pa ni gti mug gi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: In this context, the absence of delusion, which is indivisible from delusion, is the nature of delusion.

original: gti mug gi rang bzhin las gti mug med pa gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gti mug gi rang bzhin las gti mug med pa gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: If you ask why, it is because the absence of delusion is nothing other than the nature of delusion.

original: gti mug gi rang bzhin las gti mug med pa gzhan med pas gti mug gi rang bzhin nyid gti mug med pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug gi rang bzhin las gti mug med pa gzhan med pas gti mug gi rang bzhin nyid gti mug med pa ste /
translated: Since there is no absence of confusion other than the nature of confusion, the nature of confusion itself is the absence of confusion.

original: gti mug gi rang bzhin gti mug med pa'i shes pa des chos thams cad gti mug med pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug gi rang bzhin gti mug med pa'i shes pa des chos thams cad gti mug med pa'o //
translated: By means of the cognition that is the nature of confusion, all phenomena are the absence of confusion.

original: bdag ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba dang dbyer med pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa shes pa la gnas kyi /🔽gzhan dag kyang nying mtshams sbyor ba dang dbyer med pa nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbug @18a *//
analyzed: bdag ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba dang dbyer med pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa shes pa la gnas kyi / gzhan dag kyang nying mtshams sbyor ba dang dbyer med pa nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa shes pa la dgod do zhes dbug @18a *//
translated: “I am one who is settled in the cognition of the absence of rebirth that is inseparable from rebirth,

original: 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will cause others to be settled in the cognition of the absence of rebirth that is inseparable from rebirth.”🔽In this regard, the absence of rebirth that is inseparable from rebirth is the nature of rebirth.

original: de la nying mtshams sbyor ba dang dbyer med pa nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la nying mtshams sbyor ba dang dbyer med pa nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The absence of rebirth is not other than the nature of rebirth.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rang bzhin las nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa gzhan med pas nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rang bzhin nyid nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rang bzhin las nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa gzhan med pas nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rang bzhin nyid nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa'o //
translated: Since there is nothing other than the nature of linking that is not linking, the nature of linking is itself the absence of linking.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rang bzhin nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa shes pa des chos thams cad nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa ste /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rang bzhin nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa shes pa des chos thams cad nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa ste /
translated: Through this understanding of the nature of linking as the absence of linking, all phenomena are understood to be without linking.

original: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //🔽'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o // 'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, these five discoveries of inspiration are the first purifications of the bodhisattvas.

original: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, there are another five discoveries of inspiration that purify the bodhisattvas’ first bhūmi.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are these five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: ‘I abide in the knowledge of the means of attracting others through generosity.

original: gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po'i shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po'i shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will cause others to take up the knowledge of the means of gathering through generosity.

original: de la sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po ni gtong ba dang / bsngo ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po ni gtong ba dang / bsngo ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here the means of gathering through generosity is the giving and the dedication.

original: bdag ni snyan par smra ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po @18b shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni snyan par smra ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po @18b shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: I will stand in the knowledge of the means of gathering through agreeable speech,

original: gzhan dag kyang snyan par smra ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang snyan par smra ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will cause others to take up the knowledge of the means of gathering through agreeable speech.

original: de la snyan par smra ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po ni bsam pa dang / sbyor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la snyan par smra ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po ni bsam pa dang / sbyor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here the means of gathering through agreeable speech is the intention and the application.🔽I will stand in the knowledge of the means of gathering through beneficence,🔽and I will cause others to take up the knowledge of the means of gathering through beneficence.🔽Here the means of gathering through beneficence is the giving of material goods and the giving of the Dharma.

original: bdag ni don sbyod pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni don sbyod pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: I will stand in the knowledge of the means of gathering through consistency between words and deeds,

original: gzhan dag kyang don spyod pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang don spyod pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will cause others to take up the knowledge of the means of gathering through consistency between words and deeds.🔽Here the means of gathering through consistency between words and deeds is the non-deceptive practice of the four means of gathering.

original: de la don spyod pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po ni byams pa dang / snying rje gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la don spyod pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po ni byams pa dang / snying rje gang yin pa'o //
translated: The means of attraction that consists of beneficial actions is loving kindness and compassion.

original: bdag ni don mthun pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po shes pa la gnas kyi; gzhan dag kyang don mthun pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag ni don mthun pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po shes pa la gnas kyi; gzhan dag kyang don mthun pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “I have attained the patience of the non-arising of all things, and I will lead others to the patience of the non-arising of all things.”

original: de la don mthun pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po ni thabs dang / shes rab gang yin pa'o //🔽bdag ni rtsom pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: de la don mthun pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po ni thabs dang / shes rab gang yin pa'o // bdag ni rtsom pa la gnas kyi /
translated: The means of attraction that consists of practicing what one preaches is skill in means and wisdom.

original: gzhan dag kyang rtsom pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang rtsom pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “I have attained the patience of the non-arising of all things, and I will lead others to the patience of the non-arising of all things.”

original: de la rtsom pa ni bsam pa dang / sbyor ba gang yin pa ste; 'jam dpal /
analyzed: de la rtsom pa ni bsam pa dang / sbyor ba gang yin pa ste; 'jam dpal /
translated: The means of attraction that consists of practicing what one preaches is skill in means and wisdom.🔽“I am engaged in undertaking, and I will engage others in undertaking.”🔽The undertaking is the intention and the application.

original: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, these five kinds of relief are the first purification of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
translated: “Mañjuśrī,

original: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
translated: “There are five kinds of relief that purify the bodhisattvas’ first stage.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽bdag ni 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la gnas kyi /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / bdag ni 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la gnas kyi /
translated: They are as follows:

original: @19a *// gzhan dag kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la dgod do zhes dbubs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: @19a *// gzhan dag kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la dgod do zhes dbubs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: ‘I have attained the relief of thinking, “I am living in freedom from desire, and I will lead others to freedom from desire.”

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ni chos thams cad la mi gnas par 'jug pa'o //🔽bdag ni zhe sdang dang bral ba nyid la gnas kyi /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ni chos thams cad la mi gnas par 'jug pa'o // bdag ni zhe sdang dang bral ba nyid la gnas kyi /
translated: In this case, freedom from desire means to engage in the non-fixation on all phenomena.🔽‘I have attained the relief of thinking, “I am living in freedom from anger, and I will lead others to freedom from anger.”

original: gzhan dag kyang zhe sdang dang bral ba nyid la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te; de la zhe sdang dang bral ba nyid ni sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang zhe sdang dang bral ba nyid la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te; de la zhe sdang dang bral ba nyid ni sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: In this case, freedom from anger means to have a mind that is not hostile toward any sentient being.

original: bdag ni lus sdom pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni lus sdom pa la gnas kyi /
translated: ‘I have attained the relief of thinking, “I am living in physical restraint, and I will lead others to physical restraint.”

original: gzhan dag kyang lus sdom pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang lus sdom pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will also establish others in the restraint of the body.

original: de la lus sdom pa ni lus kyi las kyi skyon rnam pa gsum yongs su spong ba nyid gang yin pa'o //🔽bdag ni ngag gi sdom pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: de la lus sdom pa ni lus kyi las kyi skyon rnam pa gsum yongs su spong ba nyid gang yin pa'o // bdag ni ngag gi sdom pa la gnas kyi /
translated: The restraint of the body is the complete abandonment of the three faults of bodily action.

original: gzhan dag kyang ngag gi sdom pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ngag gi sdom pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will also establish others in the restraint of speech.

original: de la ngag gi sdom pa ni ngag gi las kyi nyes pa rnam pa bzhi yongs su spong ba nyid gang yin pa'o //🔽bdag ni yid kyi sdom pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: de la ngag gi sdom pa ni ngag gi las kyi nyes pa rnam pa bzhi yongs su spong ba nyid gang yin pa'o // bdag ni yid kyi sdom pa la gnas kyi /
translated: The restraint of speech is the complete abandonment of the four faults of verbal action.

original: gzhan dag kyang yid kyi sdom pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang yid kyi sdom pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will also establish others in the restraint of mind.

original: de la yid kyi sdom pa ni brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba yongs su spong ba nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la yid kyi sdom pa ni brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba yongs su spong ba nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: The restraint of mind is the complete abandonment of covetousness, harmful intent, and wrong views.

original: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag @19b ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag @19b ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, these five discoveries of inspiration purify the bodhisattvas’ first ground.

analyzed: de la las kyi rnam par smin pa la nem nur med pa ni rtag pa dang / chad pa yongs su sdangs pa gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: bdag ni brjod du med pa la gnas kyi /

analyzed: gzhan dag kyang brjod du med pa @34b la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will also establish others in the inexpressible.

translated: The inexpressible is the absence of mental activity and the absence of exaggeration with regard to mind, thought, and consciousness.🔽“I will stand in the knowledge of the realm of phenomena

original: gzhan dag kyang chos kyi dbyings shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang chos kyi dbyings shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de la chos kyi dbyings shes pa ni chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa gnyis su med par shes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the realm of phenomena is the knowledge that all phenomena are the realm of phenomena, which is indivisible and nondual.

original: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //🔽'jam dpal / gzhan yang /

analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

analyzed: bdag ni spong ba la gnas kyi /

analyzed: de la spong ba ni dmigs pa dag la med pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa dang / rlom sems gang yin pa'o //

original: bdag ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes la gnas kyi /

original: gzhan dag kyang sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes ni mtha' dang mtha' med pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa'o // bdag ni tshig gi mtshams @35a *//

original: sbyor ba shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: sbyor ba shes pa la gnas kyi /

analyzed: gzhan dag kyang tshig gi mtshams sbyor ba shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /

analyzed: gzhan dag kyang des pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de la des pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa'i gzhi gang yin pa'o // bdag ni bdud kyi las dang bral ba la gnas kyi /
translated: Gentleness is the basis of benefit for all sentient beings.🔽“One should breathe out, thinking, ‘May I abide in freedom from the works of Māra

original: gzhan dag kyang bdud kyi las dang bral ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bdud kyi las dang bral ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /

translated: Freedom from the works of Māra is the thorough understanding of the views.

analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: gzhan dag kyang nga rgyal med pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: One finds solace in the thought: I will live in such a way that I may establish others in the absence of pride.

analyzed: de la nga rgyal med pa ni sems can la shin tu gus pa gang yin pa'o // bdag ni 'khon du 'dzin pa med pa la gnas kyi /

analyzed: gzhan dag kyang 'khon du 'dzin pa med pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /

translated: The absence of resentment is the pacification of mental anguish.🔽 One finds solace in the thought: I will live in such a way that I may establish others in the absence of deceit.

translated: Mañjuśrī, moreover,

analyzed: de la tshul 'chos pa med pa ni zang zing med pa'i sems kyis gzhan la phan 'dogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, living without hypocrisy means to benefit others with a mind free of material desires.

original: bdag ni kha gsag med pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni kha gsag med pa la gnas kyi /
translated: ‘I live without flattery,🔽and I inspire others

original: gzhan dag kyang kha gsag med pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang kha gsag med pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: to live without flattery.’

analyzed: de la kha gsag med pa ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pas yongs su len pa gtong ba gang yin pa'o // bdag ni thob kyis 'jal ba med pa la gnas kyi /
translated: There, not being a braggart is the giving of the relinquishment of the taking up of the full accomplishment of sentient beings.🔽One finds inspiration by thinking, I will live without being deceitful, and I will help others to live without being deceitful.🔽There, not being deceitful is the giving of the relinquishment of the taking up of the full accomplishment of sentient beings.

original: gzhan dag kyang thob kyis 'jal ba med pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang thob kyis 'jal ba med pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: One finds inspiration by thinking, I will live without being a cheat, and I will help others to live without being a cheat.🔽There, not being a cheat is the giving of the relinquishment of the taking up of the full accomplishment of sentient beings.🔽One finds inspiration by thinking, I will live in a state of non-possession, and I will help others to live in a state of non-possession.🔽There, a state of non-possession is the giving of the relinquishment of the taking up of the full accomplishment of sentient beings.🔽One finds inspiration by thinking, I will live in a state of non-appropriation, and I will help others to live in a state of non-appropriation.

original: de la thob kyis 'jal ba med pa ni 'phags pa'i rigs yang dag par blangs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa gang yin pa'o //🔽bdag ni 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa la gnas kyi /

translated: There, a state of non-appropriation is the giving of the relinquishment of the taking up of the full accomplishment of sentient beings.🔽One finds inspiration by thinking, I will live in a state of non-grasping, and I will help others to live in a state of non-grasping.🔽There, a state of non-grasping is the giving of the relinquishment of the taking up of the full accomplishment of sentient beings.

original: gzhan dag kyang 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: One finds inspiration by thinking, I will live in a state of purity, and I will help others to live in a state of purity.🔽There, a state of purity is the giving of the relinquishment of the taking up of the full accomplishment of sentient beings.

original: de la 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi yo byad gang mi len pa de ci'ang med pa dang / bde ba'i yo byad gang mi gtong ba de ci'ang med pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi yo byad gang mi len pa de ci'ang med pa dang / bde ba'i yo byad gang mi gtong ba de ci'ang med pa'o //
translated: As for the purity of livelihood, there is nothing that he would not take up as a means of suffering, in order to uphold the holy Dharma, and there is nothing that he would not give up as a means of happiness.

original: bdag ni gcig pur dga' ba la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni gcig pur dga' ba la gnas kyi /
translated: “I am living in the joy of solitude,🔽and I will lead others to the joy of solitude.”

original: gzhan dag kyang gcig pur dga' ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur @36b te; de la gcig pur dga' ba ni 'du 'dzi yongs su spong ba dga' ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang gcig pur dga' ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur @36b te; de la gcig pur dga' ba ni 'du 'dzi yongs su spong ba dga' ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The joy of solitude is the joy of abandoning crowds.

translated: Mañjuśrī, these five discoveries of inspiration purify the bodhisattvas’ first ground.

analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, there are another five discoveries of inspiration that purify the bodhisattvas’ first ground.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

analyzed: 'di lta ste / bdag ni chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba la gnas kyi /
translated: It is as follows.

original: gzhan dag kyang chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “I have attained the assurance of enlightenment that consists of delighting in the pleasure of the Dharma, and I will delight others in the pleasure of the Dharma.”

translated: The pleasure of the Dharma is the non-fear of the three realms of existence and the non-loss of the thought of enlightenment.

analyzed: gzhan dag kyang sems can thams cad kyi slob mar khas len pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “I will stand in the acceptance of being a student of all sentient beings, and I will cause others to stand in the acceptance of being a student of all sentient beings.”

translated: The acceptance of being a student of all sentient beings is the willingness to do whatever needs to be done.

analyzed: bdag ni sbyin gnas rnams la 'dud pa dang / phyag bya ba la gnas kyi /
