original: gzhan dag kyang sbyin gnas rnams la 'dud pa dang / phyag bya ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang sbyin gnas rnams la 'dud pa dang / phyag bya ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will cause others to bow down and pay homage to those who are worthy of receiving offerings.

analyzed: de la sbyin gnas rnams la 'dud pa dang / phyag bya ba ni sems can thams cad la nga rgyal med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Bowing down and paying homage to those who are worthy of receiving offerings is the absence of pride toward all sentient beings.

translated: The pursuit of the true Dharma is to be indefatigable in bringing all sentient beings to full maturity, to purify the buddha-fields, to accumulate moral discipline and learning, to be diligent in seeking the Dharma, and not to accept or give up generosity.

analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, there are another five attainments of bliss that purify the bodhisattvas’ first bhūmi.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag ni ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa rnams gzhom pa'ang ma yin /🔽ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa rnams mi gzhom pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba la zhugs kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa rnams gzhom pa'ang ma yin / ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa rnams mi gzhom pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba la zhugs kyi /
translated: ‘I am not destroying the afflictions with wisdom,🔽nor am I not destroying the afflictions with wisdom.’🔽Others should also be caused to enter into the statement, ‘I am not destroying the afflictions with wisdom, nor am I not destroying the afflictions with wisdom.’

original: gzhan dag kyang ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa rnams gzhon pa'ang ma @42b yin; ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa rnams mi gzhom pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba la gzud do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa rnams gzhon pa'ang ma @42b yin; ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa rnams mi gzhom pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba la gzud do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they will obtain relief.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin las ye shes gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin las ye shes gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because wisdom is not other than the nature of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin las ye shes gzhan med pas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ye shes yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin las ye shes gzhan med pas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ye shes yin te /
translated: Since wisdom is not other than the nature of the afflictions, the nature of the afflictions is wisdom.

original: ye shes des ye shes de nyid btsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes des ye shes de nyid btsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: That wisdom should not be sought in that wisdom.

original: dper na / mdzub mo'i rtse mo de nyid kyis mdzub mo'i rtse mo de nyid la reg par mi rung ba de ltar ye shes de nyid kyis ye shes de nyid btsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / mdzub mo'i rtse mo de nyid kyis mdzub mo'i rtse mo de nyid la reg par mi rung ba de ltar ye shes de nyid kyis ye shes de nyid btsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: For example, just as the tip of a finger cannot touch itself, so too that very pristine wisdom cannot be sought by that very pristine wisdom.

original: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: “I have entered into the Tathāgata not being permanent

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba la zhugs kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba la zhugs kyi /
translated: and the Tathāgata not being impermanent.”

original: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'ang ma yin /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba la gzud do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'ang ma yin / de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba la gzud do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “I will cause others to enter into the Tathāgata not being permanent

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: and the Tathāgata not being impermanent.”

original: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni rlom sems kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni rlom sems kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “The Tathāgata not being permanent and the Tathāgata not being impermanent” means that the essence of conceit does not exist.

original: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba'i ye shes 'di la zhugs kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba'i ye shes 'di la zhugs kyi /
translated: “I have entered into the pristine wisdom of the Tathāgata being inconceivable.”

original: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba'i ye shes 'di la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /🔽de la de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni sems @43a *//
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba'i ye shes 'di la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te / de la de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni sems @43a *//
translated: And they will find solace in the thought: We will establish others in this knowledge that the Tathagatas are inconceivable.

original: can gdul ba ji lta ba dang / bsam pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam par bzhag pa las mi 'da' ba gang yin pa'o //🔽bdag ni gzugs mtshan nyid med do zhes bya ba la zhugs kyi /
analyzed: can gdul ba ji lta ba dang / bsam pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam par bzhag pa las mi 'da' ba gang yin pa'o // bdag ni gzugs mtshan nyid med do zhes bya ba la zhugs kyi /
translated: The inconceivability of the Tathagatas is that they do not transgress the principles of the training of sentient beings and of the inclinations of sentient beings.🔽One should find solace in the thought: I am engaged in the fact that form is without defining characteristics,

original: gzhan dag kyang gzugs mtshan nyid med do zhes bya ba la gzud do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang gzugs mtshan nyid med do zhes bya ba la gzud do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will engage others in the fact that form is without defining characteristics.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gzugs ni mtshan nyid med pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / gzugs ni mtshan nyid med pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because form is not other than the nature of non-defining characteristics.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin las mtshan nyid med pa gzhan med pas gzugs kyi rang bzhin nyid mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin las mtshan nyid med pa gzhan med pas gzugs kyi rang bzhin nyid mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: Since there is no defining characteristic of form other than the nature of form, the nature of form is itself without defining characteristics.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid med pa shes pa des chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'o //🔽bdag ni thabs mkhas pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid med pa shes pa des chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'o // bdag ni thabs mkhas pa la gnas kyi /
translated: By knowing that the nature of form is without characteristics, one knows that all phenomena are without characteristics.

original: gzhan dag kyang thabs mkhas pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang thabs mkhas pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “ One should inspire oneself, thinking, ‘I will abide in skillful means and I will establish others in skillful means.’

original: de la thabs mkhas pa ni chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pa ste /
analyzed: de la thabs mkhas pa ni chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pa ste /
translated: Skillful means is the correct inclusion of all phenomena.

original: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //🔽'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o // 'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, these five discoveries of inspiration purify the first bodhisattva ground.

original: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
translated: “ Mañjuśrī, there are another five discoveries of inspiration that purify the first bodhisattva ground.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are these five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag ni bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa la gnas kyi /
translated: ‘I will abide in the inexhaustible accumulation of merit

original: gzhan dag kyang bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa la dgod do zhes dbugs @43b 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa la dgod do zhes dbugs @43b 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will also establish others in the inexhaustible accumulation of merit.

original: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub tu bsngos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub tu bsngos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The inexhaustible accumulation of merit is the dedication of the roots of virtue to enlightenment.

original: bdag ni ye shes kyi tshogs la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni ye shes kyi tshogs la gnas kyi /
translated: “I am standing in the accumulation of wisdom;

original: gzhan dag kyang ye shes kyi tshogs la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ye shes kyi tshogs la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will also establish others in the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de la ye shes kyi tshogs ni stong pa nyid la mos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes kyi tshogs ni stong pa nyid la mos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The accumulation of wisdom is the aspiration to emptiness.

original: bdag ni shes rab kyi rtsa ba las byung ba'i las la gnas kyis /
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab kyi rtsa ba las byung ba'i las la gnas kyis /
translated: “I am standing in the action that arises from the root of wisdom;

original: gzhan dag kyang shes rab kyi rtsa ba las byung ba'i las la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang shes rab kyi rtsa ba las byung ba'i las la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will also establish others in the action that arises from the root of wisdom.

original: de la shes rab kyi rtsa ba las byung ba'i las ni bdag nyid chos dkar po la gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi rtsa ba las byung ba'i las ni bdag nyid chos dkar po la gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The action that arises from the root of wisdom is the establishment of oneself in the wholesome dharmas.

original: yang shes rab kyi rtsa ba las byung ba'i las ni gzhan shes rab la dgod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang shes rab kyi rtsa ba las byung ba'i las ni gzhan shes rab la dgod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The action that arises from the root of wisdom is to establish others in wisdom.

original: bdag ni ting nge 'dzin la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni ting nge 'dzin la gnas kyi /
translated: “I am established in meditative absorption;

original: gzhan dag kyang ting nge 'dzin la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ting nge 'dzin la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will establish others in meditative absorption.”

original: de la ting nge 'dzin ni sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin ni sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Meditative absorption is the meditative absorption of one without thought.

original: bdag ni so so yang dag par rtog pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni so so yang dag par rtog pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I am established in discernment;

original: gzhan dag kyang so so yang dag par rtog pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang so so yang dag par rtog pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will establish others in discernment.”

original: de la so so yang dag par rtog pa ni las dang bya ba la 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la so so yang dag par rtog pa ni las dang bya ba la 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Discernment is the engagement in action.

original: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, these five discoveries of inspiration purify the first ground of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'jam dpal / @44a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / @44a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: gzhan yang / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
translated: bodhisattvas find five kinds of relief that purify the first bodhisattva stage.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽bdag ni dbu ma'i lam shes pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / bdag ni dbu ma'i lam shes pa la gnas kyi /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzhan dag kyang dbu ma'i lam shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang dbu ma'i lam shes pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “I am practicing the knowledge of the middle way, and I will cause others to adopt the knowledge of the middle way.”

original: de la dbu ma'i lam ni mtha' rnam par dag pa shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbu ma'i lam ni mtha' rnam par dag pa shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: In this context, the middle way is the knowledge of the purification of extremes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtha'i rang bzhin las dbu ma'i lam gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtha'i rang bzhin las dbu ma'i lam gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the middle way is not other than the nature of extremes.

original: mtha'i rang bzhin las dbu ma'i lam gzhan med pas mtha'i rang bzhin nyid dbu ma'i lam mo //🔽bdag ni chos thams cad rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la gnas kyi /
analyzed: mtha'i rang bzhin las dbu ma'i lam gzhan med pas mtha'i rang bzhin nyid dbu ma'i lam mo // bdag ni chos thams cad rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la gnas kyi /
translated: Since the middle way is not other than the nature of extremes, the nature of extremes is the middle way.

original: gzhan dag kyang chos thams cad rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang chos thams cad rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “I am practicing the knowledge that all phenomena are permanent, and I will cause others to adopt the knowledge that all phenomena are permanent.”

original: de la chos thams cad rtag pa ni mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad rtag pa ni mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, all phenomena are permanent because they are without end or middle.

original: chos thams cad mtha' dang / dbus med pa ni 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtha' dang / dbus med pa ni 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: All phenomena are without end or middle because they are not other than the nature of the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin las mtha' dang / dbus med pa gzhan med pas 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin nyid mtha' dang / dbus med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin las mtha' dang / dbus med pa gzhan med pas 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin nyid mtha' dang / dbus med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no end or middle apart from the nature of the conditioned, the nature of the conditioned is itself without end or middle.

original: mtha' dang / dbus med pa gang yin pa de ni rtag pa /
analyzed: mtha' dang / dbus med pa gang yin pa de ni rtag pa /
translated: That which is without end or middle is permanent,

original: brtan pa / ther zug pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa / ther zug pa'o //
translated: stable, and eternal.

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas la mchod pa bye brag tu mngon par 'phags pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas la mchod pa bye brag tu mngon par 'phags pa la gnas kyi /
translated: “I am practicing the special worship of the Buddha,

original: gzhan dag kyang @44b sangs rgyas la mchod pa bye brag tu mngon par 'phags pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang @44b sangs rgyas la mchod pa bye brag tu mngon par 'phags pa la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will cause others to take up the special worship of the Buddha.”

original: de la sangs rgyas la mchod pa bye brag tu mngon par 'phags pa ni theg pa chen po la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bsnyen cing bsten pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed cing rnyed pa dang / bkur sti byas te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas la mchod pa bye brag tu mngon par 'phags pa ni theg pa chen po la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bsnyen cing bsten pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed cing rnyed pa dang / bkur sti byas te /
translated: The most exalted worship of the buddhas is to serve, attend, and honor the bodhisattvas who have faith in the Great Vehicle, and to give them whatever they need,

original: ci nus kyi theg pa chen po yang dag par bskyed cing sbyin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ci nus kyi theg pa chen po yang dag par bskyed cing sbyin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and to generate the Great Vehicle in them to the best of one’s ability.

original: bdag ni chos thams cad 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba la gnas kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni chos thams cad 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba la gnas kyi /
translated: “I stand in the non-production of all things,

original: gzhan dag kyang chos thams cad 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang chos thams cad 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba la dgod do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and I will establish others in the non-production of all things.”

original: de la chos thams cad 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de ni 'dus byas kyi tshig go /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de ni 'dus byas kyi tshig go /
translated: There, the non-production of all things is a term for the produced.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin las 'dus ma byas gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin las 'dus ma byas gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the unproduced is not other than the nature of the produced.

original: 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin las 'dus ma byas gzhan med pas 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin nyid 'dus ma byas te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin las 'dus ma byas gzhan med pas 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin nyid 'dus ma byas te /
translated: Since the unconditioned does not exist apart from the nature of the conditioned, the nature of the conditioned is itself the unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin 'dus ma byas shes pa des chos thams cad 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin 'dus ma byas shes pa des chos thams cad 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: By knowing the unconditioned nature of the conditioned, all dharmas are unconditioned.

original: bdag ni chos thams cad stong ngo zhes bya ba la zhugs kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni chos thams cad stong ngo zhes bya ba la zhugs kyi /
translated: “I have entered into the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: gzhan dag chos thams cad stong ngo zhes bya ba la gzud do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag chos thams cad stong ngo zhes bya ba la gzud do zhes dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: I will cause others to enter into the emptiness of all dharmas.”

original: de la stong pa nyid ni lta bar gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid ni lta bar gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: In this regard, emptiness is any view.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: stong pa nyid ni lta bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin @45a *//🔽pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni lta bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin @45a *// pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because emptiness is not other than the nature of views.

original: lta bar gyur pa'i rang bzhin las stong pa nyid gzhan med pas lta bar gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa'i rang bzhin las stong pa nyid gzhan med pas lta bar gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since emptiness is not other than the nature of views, the nature of views is itself emptiness.

original: lta bar gyur pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid shes pa des chos thams cad stong ste /
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid shes pa des chos thams cad stong ste /
translated: Through the knowledge of the emptiness of the nature of views, all phenomena are empty.

original: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, these five discoveries of inspiration purify the bodhisattvas’ first ground.

original: 'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, moreover,

original: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pa lnga dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa dang po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur te /
translated: there are five discoveries of inspiration that purify the bodhisattvas’ first ground.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are these five?

original: khyu mchog tu gyur pa mdor bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: khyu mchog tu gyur pa mdor bstan pa yin te /

translated: If I were to bless the teaching to remain until the end of time, it would not be possible to teach it in detail.

original: 'jam dpal / de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i kun nas mngon du gyur pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams re re dang / gling re re dang / rdul phra rab re re la ste /🔽@67b rdul phra rab kyi rdul gyi phyogs re re la byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho 'khod pa ni rab tu mang gi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i kun nas mngon du gyur pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams re re dang / gling re re dang / rdul phra rab re re la ste / @67b rdul phra rab kyi rdul gyi phyogs re re la byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho 'khod pa ni rab tu mang gi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the thus-gone ones’ all-pervasiveness is such that in each world system in the infinite universes of the ten directions, in each continent, and in each atom,🔽there are many oceans of bodhisattvas.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams lnga bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho grangs med pa dag gi rdul phra rab ni ches nyung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams lnga bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho grangs med pa dag gi rdul phra rab ni ches nyung ste /
translated: The atoms in the oceans of worlds, which are as numerous as the atoms in fifty worlds, are far fewer than the bodhisattvas in a single atom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni sems can dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dang / gling dang / ri rab dang / ri rab chen po dang / khor yug dang / khor yug chen po dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni sems can dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dang / gling dang / ri rab dang / ri rab chen po dang / khor yug dang / khor yug chen po dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang /
translated: Those bodhisattvas do not harm or obstruct any sentient beings, or any world systems, or any continents, or any Mount Merus, or any Great Mount Merus, or any Cakravāḍas, or any Great Cakravāḍas, or any villages, or any towns, or any market towns,

original: ljongs dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dang / 'bab chu dang / mtshe'u dang / mtsho bran dag gang la'ang gnod pa dang / sgrib pa med de /
analyzed: ljongs dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dang / 'bab chu dang / mtshe'u dang / mtsho bran dag gang la'ang gnod pa dang / sgrib pa med de /
translated: or any regions, or any countries, or any royal palaces, or any waterfalls, or any ponds, or any lakes.

original: sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin du bya ba dag 'jug ste /
analyzed: sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin du bya ba dag 'jug ste /
translated: They act in the same way later as they did in the past.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Tathāgata is endowed with unmixed qualities.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba'i lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang /
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba'i lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang /
translated: According to their intentions and according to their discipline, those gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, Śakras,

original: tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis kyang 'di ltar kun nas de bzhin gshegs pa gnya' shing gang tsam na bzhugs par mngon du mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis kyang 'di ltar kun nas de bzhin gshegs pa gnya' shing gang tsam na bzhugs par mngon du mthong ngo //
translated: The Brahmās, the Lokapālas, the humans, the non-humans, and the bodhisattvas all saw the Tathāgata sitting in front of them, at a distance of an arrow-shot.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why was that?

original: ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he was endowed with the unshared qualities of a buddha.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / zla ba yar gyi ngo tshes bco lnga'i nam phyed kyi dus na dzambu'i gling gi skyes pa dang / bud @68a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste / dper na / zla ba yar gyi ngo tshes bco lnga'i nam phyed kyi dus na dzambu'i gling gi skyes pa dang / bud @68a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:🔽For example, at midnight on the fifteenth day of the waxing phase of the moon, all the men, women, boys, and girls of Jambudvīpa see the orb of the moon in front of them.

original: med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo thams cad kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor mdun na 'dug par mthong yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni mi rtog /🔽rnam par mi rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo thams cad kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor mdun na 'dug par mthong yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni mi rtog / rnam par mi rtog mod kyi /
translated: But the orb of the moon does not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir mi rtog cing lhun gyis grub par bya ba 'di lta bu 'di dag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir mi rtog cing lhun gyis grub par bya ba 'di lta bu 'di dag 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, because it is endowed with the unshared qualities of the moon, these kinds of non-conceptual and spontaneous activities occur.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad kyi sems can bsam pa ji lta ba dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mdun na bzhugs par mthong yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog rnam par mi rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad kyi sems can bsam pa ji lta ba dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mdun na bzhugs par mthong yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog rnam par mi rtog mod kyi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the Tathāgata is seen by sentient beings in the infinite world systems of the ten directions, in accordance with their aspirations and their discipline. However, the Tathāgata is non-conceptual and non-discriminating.

original: 'on kyang ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir mi rtog cing lhun gyis grub par mdzad pa 'di lta bu 'di dag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir mi rtog cing lhun gyis grub par mdzad pa 'di lta bu 'di dag 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, because he possesses the unshared qualities, these non-conceptual and spontaneous activities occur.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa'i kun nas mngon du gyur pa mdor bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa'i kun nas mngon du gyur pa mdor bstan pa yin te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, this is a brief teaching on the Tathāgata’s all-pervasiveness.

original: rgyas par ni phyi ma'i mtha'i mu'i bskal par byin gyis brlabs kyang bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: rgyas par ni phyi ma'i mtha'i mu'i bskal par byin gyis brlabs kyang bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Even if one were to bless the eons of the future in detail, one would not be able to teach it.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing yongs su sbyong ba la mi 'jigs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams re re dang; rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing yongs su sbyong ba la mi 'jigs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams re re dang; rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi
translated: Manjusri, the Tathagata's fearlessness in purifying the Buddha-fields is the purification of all the Buddha-fields in the infinite universes of the ten directions, in each atom of each universe, in each Buddha-field, in each Tathagata's assembly.
